title: How to Make Aluminum Foil Origami

steps.headline: Use a ruler for measuring the squares or rectangles.
Cut with a sharpened razor blade or knife.
When you cut, cut along the edge of the ruler.
Do not fold the same fold more than once!
steps.description: This will rip your foil! (however, if you do than follow step five.)

steps.headline: Glue a piece of paper to the bottom: It will hold it together and allow you to fold more that once on one fold.
Once done: don't mess with it.
If it rips, don't fix it; just throw it away:  It's a lot of work just to try to fix it.
Get thicker foil(it might be more expensive but it will still work better)
Be patient; you might not get it right the first time.

text: Use a ruler for measuring the squares or rectangles.  Cut with a sharpened razor blade or knife. (Scissors will not work very well!) When you cut, cut along the edge of the ruler.  Do not fold the same fold more than once! This will rip your foil! (however, if you do than follow step five.) Glue a piece of paper to the bottom: It will hold it together and allow you to fold more that once on one fold.  Once done: don't mess with it.  If it rips, don't fix it; just throw it away:  It's a lot of work just to try to fix it.  Get thicker foil(it might be more expensive but it will still work better)  Be patient; you might not get it right the first time.
